questions.question: In what year did Elizabeth become queen?

choices.answer: Raising taxes
The day to day running of the country

choices.answer: Giving out loans to nobles
Ensuring support using the threat of execution

questions.question: What were recunsancy fines?

choices.answer: Fines for people who did not wear ruffs in public

questions.question: What was the main aim of the Jesuits?

choices.answer: To convert the Protestant population to the Catholic faith.
To spy on Elizabeth
To hold prophesyings
To promote Puritan beliefs in England.

questions.question: What is prophesying?

choices.answer: Secret meetings to promote the Catholic rebellions.
To put Mary Queen of Scots on the throne
Fines for not going to Protest Church services
A secret meeting of Protestants who criticise Elizabeth

questions.question: Why were Henry Barrow and John Greenwood executed in 1593?

Set up their own separatist church
They attempted to assassinate the queen

questions.question: Why was there tension between Spain and England?

choices.answer: Sir Francis Drake raided Spanish Ports and ships

choices.answer: A new type of sail which allowed for faster travel

questions.question: How many out of 151 ships, returned to Spain?

questions.question: What was a ‘ruff’?

choices.answer: The noise a dog makes
An item of clothing worn on the legs

An type of head dress worn in the Tudor period.

questions.question: What was 'rack renting'?

choices.answer: When landlords unfairly took land off peasants
When landlords unfairly increased rents

choices.answer: Rack renting
Closure of the monasteries
Enclosure
